documentType: Sex Offender Registration Records and Correspondence
summary: This document is a collection of New York State Sex Offender Registry records and related correspondence for Jeffrey Epstein, including his registration form, a 2010 Board of Examiners report, attorney letters regarding registration compliance, and a detailed 2018 annual address verification form. It details Epstein's registration status, addresses, vehicles, and internet accounts following his Florida conviction.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the sex offender registration documents, providing his personal details, addresses, vehicles, and internet information as required by New York State law.

persons.name: Darren K. Indyke
persons.context: Epstein's attorney who wrote to the NY Sex Offender Registry in 2016 to provide Epstein's new passport information and confirm its issuance.

persons.name: Martin G. Weinberg
persons.context: Epstein's attorney who wrote a detailed letter in July 2010 to the NY Division of Criminal Justice Services explaining Epstein's registration status, travel intentions, and seeking clarification on reporting requirements.

persons.name: Michelle Harrington
persons.role: NY State Division of Criminal Justice Services Employee
persons.context: The recipient of Martin Weinberg's 2010 letter at the NY Division of Criminal Justice Services regarding Epstein's registration.

persons.name: Kimberly Homan
persons.context: Colleague of Martin Weinberg who spoke with Michelle Harrington on July 19, 2010, about Epstein's registration status.

persons.name: Michael C Green
persons.context: Executive Deputy Commissioner of the NY State Division of Criminal Justice Services, whose name appears on a notice sent with the annual address verification form.

connections.description: Indyke acts as Epstein's attorney, corresponding with the NY Sex Offender Registry on his behalf regarding passport updates and registration.
Weinberg acts as Epstein's attorney, providing detailed legal correspondence to NY authorities about Epstein's registration obligations and travel plans.
Homan is described as Weinberg's colleague and assisted in communications regarding Epstein's registration.

events.title: Epstein's Guilty Plea in Florida
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein pleaded guilty to two criminal charges in Palm Beach County, Florida: solicitation of prostitution and procuring a person under 18 for prostitution.

events.title: Conclusion of Florida Sentence
events.description: Epstein's Florida sentence, consisting of incarceration and community control, concluded on this date.

events.title: Initial NY Registration
events.description: Epstein filled out and presented registration forms to the NYPD Sex Offender Monitoring Unit (SOMU) in New York City.

events.title: Meeting with NYPD SOMU
events.description: Epstein, accompanied by attorney Darren Indyke, met with Sergeant and an officer at the NYPD SOMU to discuss travel reporting requirements.

events.title: Issuance of New Passport
events.description: Epstein was issued a new United States Passport, as reported by his attorney to the NY Sex Offender Registry.

events.title: Certification of Sex Offender Records
events.description: A New York State Office Assistant certified the annexed sex offender registration records for Jeffrey Epstein as true and exact copies.

locations: Little St James, 6100 Red Hook Quarter, St Thomas, VI 00802
Great St James, US Virgin Islands
Alfred E. Smith Building, 80 South Swan Street, Albany, NY 12210
575 Lexington Avenue, 4th Floor, New York, New York 10022
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was a registered sex offender in New York State due to his 2008 Florida conviction for procuring a person under 18 for prostitution.
Epstein maintained multiple residences, including in New York City, the US Virgin Islands, Palm Beach, Florida, and Stanley, New Mexico.
The documents list an extensive inventory of Epstein's assets, including numerous luxury vehicles, boats, and aircraft (a Boeing 727, Bell 430 helicopter, and Gulfstream jets).
Epstein's attorneys actively corresponded with New York authorities to manage his registration requirements, clarify travel reporting rules, and update his information (e.g., new passport).
The 2018 annual address verification form provides a highly detailed snapshot of Epstein's internet presence, listing email addresses, screen names, and service providers.
